website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung SSG-4100GB universal glasses are cheap and fine for casual use, but an uncomfortable fit and too-open design means 3D enthusiasts will want other primary glasses.
pros: The Samsung SSG-4100GB glasses are inexpensive for active glasses and compatible with other brands of TVs thanks to the Full HD 3D standard
Pairing them with your TV is fairly straightforward, they don't require line-of-sight, and the battery lasts a long time
cons: The glasses are fairly flimsy, the arms are quite short, and the fit is uncomfortable, especially if you wear glasses
An open design lets in more ambient light and can hinder immersion
They're not rechargeable and require a coin battery

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: tried these suckers out. they work, but not rechargeable. that's probably the sole reason that i would go with the er3d4mu from panasonic over this. i don't feel like replacing batteries. it wouldn't take long to make the difference in cost between the models up in batteries versus charging. not to mention these are a bit flimsy, the others sit well over glasses and work great. so, these aren't bad if you're on a budget, but i'd go ahead and splurge for the others, if you have the dough. it'll cost you more in the long run anyway to get these, and you'd be less happy. that being said, they work great. they just feel cheap and need batteries.
customer_reviews.author: your mother

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture Quality, A Little Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these for use with my Samsung 55 inch, 1080p, 120 hz LED television in order to have four pair instead of just the two that came with the TV. These are of a little different design than the others, not being able to be folded up for storage. Also, the headbands of these are a little more thin than the others and are just a little flimsy. The upside to these glasses are that they are considerably lighter than the others and can fit over glasses if need be. I have no real complaints here as they do what they are designed to do and do it well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tudor

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular price, works great with Epson 3020e
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these RF glasses when I purchased my new Epson 3020e projector. Glasses are lightweight, comfortable and immediately paired with the Epson projector as soon as I powered them on. Comparing them to the Epson glasses, I quite honestly couldn't tell a difference in brightness or picture quality. My wife actually preferred these to the more bulky Epson glasses (built in rechargable battery). The temples do NOT fold in, if that is concern. For the money, you can buy a ton of batteries before coming close to reaching the purchase amount for a more mainstream pair of 3d glasses with built in battery. Very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tan

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT and economical - stay away from the newer ssg-5150GB newer isn't better all the time!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are the ultimate economic version of active shutter 3D glasses. The picture pops in and out just as well as overpriced active shutter glasses but the downside is it uses one battery and the life is not that long. Wish they were rechargeable. The newer 2015 version of these with model name ssg-5150GB are AWWWWWFUL! STAY AWAY! They switched to two batteries that arenearly impossible to get in without breaking the glasses into pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Blackout (Michael Biggins)

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Budget Active 3D Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Purchased four pairs for use with my Panasonic VIERA TC-P60ST50 60" plasma. The glasses work as they should, no fancy bells or whistles. Get close to your TV, press the button to pair them with the TV and you are ready for 3D. Pick up some extra batteries for less than $2 for 5 of them. The batteries should last up to 70 hours, but that probably depends on the quality of the battery. Great if you have kids and don't want to spend $200 outfitting the family with the fancy Panasonic glasses. Might purchase a few more for when friends come over!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmer

customer_reviews.title: Price is right, better have a small head
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with a Panasonic plasma because the Panasonic glasses are $50. I wanted to see what the 3D was all about. These seem to do the job with the 3D well, I don't have anything to compare to but have watched a few things on DirectTV's 3D channels. The connected easily to my set, and remember the connection each time I turn them on. My complaint (and the 3 stars) is that the side pieces that hold it to your head are not adjustable and are rather short. Perfect for kids or smaller adults I guess, but an average size man they are not very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Very light and works fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pair of 3D Glasses, this model is very light and after putting on flexible ear arms and installing the battery, I stood in front of my Samsung 55" LED TV and watched 3D Movie load up, but really had some problem clicking switch to start the connection process. The button is very, very small. I did finally get button clicked properly and it connected right away with TV and 3D movie came into focus and looked fantastic. My ONLY complaint is how small the activation switch is. Otherwise I prefer these lighter Glasses over my previous Samsung Glasses.
customer_reviews.author: JIM C

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I will buy again from this merchant. Further, and very important. Think Green, Please protect animals and plants, recycle everything you can, no littering and use it enough to completely finish any product. Transmit this message to others. Compraré nuevamente en este negocio. adicionalmente, Piensa Verde, por favor protege a los animales y las plantas, recicla todo lo que puedas, no echar basura, usa todo hasta el final, transmite este mensaje a otros.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: Unlike passive 3D glasses, the accelerator is in the glasses itself. So beware of the headaches, your eyes feeling like they’re ready to pop. If you’re used to active 3D these are for you. But I’ll stick to my passive 3D tv.
customer_reviews.author: nextarkid122

customer_reviews.title: Obviously Cheap But Totally Get The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this 4 stars if the only other glasses weren't in the $60-$100 range. If they were a bit better priced I might suggest going for them. But, alas, these get the job done. The sit a little crookedly on my face. They are light, thin plastic. There are no guards around the edges for vision. None of this matters to me. I sit in a dark room when viewing 3D, tilt the glasses a bit more to counteract the inevitable crook, and enjoy my money well saved. In 3D.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Panasonic 2012 3d plasma
customer_reviews.text: I have one pair of "official" Panasonic 3d glasses. They are fine, just expensive. These Samsung work fine with the Panasonic 55UT Plasma we have. They let a bit of light in through the sides, but we have the tv in the basement, so it is pretty dark anyway. If you had it in a bright room, these wouldn't be ideal. That said, I think the picture on these is just a bit crisper than the actual Panasonic glasses. For the price that is awesome. Just have to see how long the batteries will last.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Finally inexpensive 3D glasses
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work very well with my Panasonic 55" Plasma TV (2012 model). At this price point I was able to get a pair of glasses for each of my kids without breaking the bank. My only complaint is that if you wear glasses like I do, these 3D glasses are rather uncomfortable to wear. If you are concerned about battery life, just buy a 25 pack of CR2025 batteries here on Amazon. We don't watch 3D often, but over the last 6 months I haven't had to change the batteries out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Babul A. Mukherjee

customer_reviews.title: A great, inexpensive alternative
customer_reviews.text: When I bought an LG 60PM6700 TV a month ago, I didn't want to pay $60-80 per pair of 3D glasses. I bought 4 pairs of these instead on a gamble because there wasn't LG compatibility listed anywhere. It turned out these worked perfectly with my TV. I hardly ever watch 3D movies so I don't need any fancy recharging system. The 'watch batteries' that run these supposedly have 100 hour life, so that'll last me a year if not more at the rate that use 3D. Buy these to keep things simple and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: mmmatt!

customer_reviews.title: Wow, how great are these?
customer_reviews.text: After paying outrageous prices for the bulky Panasonic glasses on our last 3D TV, discovering that these glasses were compatible with our new TV was a treat. They are lighter, more comfortable and WAY cheaper. The other reviewers mention a glare on the lenses if there is something bright behind you. That is true, but we generally watch our movies in near dark, so it hasn't been a problem, but it could. However at this price it can easily be overlooked, at least in my house. So if you own a CURRENT Panasonic plasma 3D TV then don't hesitate. If you own a Samsung active shutter 3D TV then shame on you for not sharing with the rest of us!
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Littlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these as a cheap alternative to the Panisonic ones, they work fine, but they go though batteries pretty quickly (like maybe 4 or 5 hours of viewing, also not having any side panels they let light in from the sides which does effect how emenced the 3D experience is. If you only watch 3D once in a while they are fine, but if you or your kids want to watch 3D often you would be better served spending the extra and getting the Panisonic rechargeable
customer_reviews.author: Kraig McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: People will laugh
customer_reviews.text: Take a quick look at the glasses from the product photos. Now imagine sitting and watching a movie when someone walks in. You are going to look hilarious because these glasses are as ugly as you could imagine. Now look at the price. You simply cannot do better. As long as you don't plan on winning any fashion awards in your living room you will love these glasses. Good quality and extremely light. Hands down the best deal on 3D glasses since they have been around.
customer_reviews.author: J. Battocletti

customer_reviews.title: Works with a Panny
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a 55" Panasonic ST plasma. It has 3D and wanted to try it. I saw the 3D on a sony early last year and it had big bulky glasses and felt awkward. Thought I would try these lightweight and inexpensive glasses on the panny. Works fine. The only issue I had was getting the battery compartment open. Bit of a trick to press down and up on something so small. Once the battery was in and clicked on the button to pair it , worked wonderfully. Recommended +1
customer_reviews.author: snuffy

customer_reviews.title: excellent 3d glasses for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a 59" 3d plasma TV for about a year now , but wasn't so excited about 3d movies because of the high price rate on the glasses that time and the not too good 3d movies , until i perchased the Avengers 3d bluray . these glasses really do what they were made for at a low price , but i recommend that when watching a 3d movie using these glasses the room must be dark because they pick light and that gets a bit annoying during the movie , other than that these glasses are a bang for your money .
customer_reviews.author: Gintoki

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2012 Panasonic plasma but ordered the Samsung glasses because they conform to the same standard and were much, much cheaper. Glad I did. The glasses work fine. The design is a little odd compared to the more traditional Panasonics, but they are comfortable and fit fine over glasses. There's not enough 3D content out there to justify spending four times as much for Panasonic but these were a reasonable price to try out the technology and they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These are the same kind of glasses that came with my Samsung Plasma. I bought a couple pairs for the rest of the family. I'm a rookie when it comes to 3D technology, so don't expect technical details about crosstalk and blah blah blah. I'm not even sure what crosstalk means. All I know is my 3D TV is awesome and these glasses are light and comfortable. I guess the only downside is you can't fold them away, but I like to display them anyways.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pascual

customer_reviews.title: Good Glasses
customer_reviews.text: These were the glasses that came with our TV and we purchased a few extras. The cost is unbeatable since they are under $20/per glasses when some of the others can be twice as much. The glasses are very light so they won't weigh down on your face after a long time. For someone with a lower bridge, this is pretty important. The quality of the viewing is excellent as well. A very good deal for those who can use them.
customer_reviews.author: JuneBean

customer_reviews.title: Pairs Perfectly with EPSON 3020
customer_reviews.text: If you are on the market for a cheaper alternative to the glasses on your EPSON 3020... YOU FOUND THEM! JUST BUY THEM! Nice: It paired with projector straight out of the box with no issues. Can't beat the price. They are not really as uncomfortable as they look like. Not so much: uses small battery, NOT rechargeable!, The legs don't fold like in other regular glasses, they seem a bit flimsy and fragile (may be perfect for kids though)
customer_reviews.author: J3T

customer_reviews.title: Active 3D glasses
customer_reviews.text: This is my first journey into 3D at home on my new 55" Panasonic Plasma TV. The glasses were as described, come with a battery and seem to be a better value than the Panasonic version. The glasses synced easily with my Panasonic UT50 and worked on 2D to 3D as well as 3D movies. The arms do not fold but can be popped out. There is no storage with the device, Even when shut off, I pop the battery to help extend the life.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: Work great, very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price. They let a lot of light in which should be obvious from the design and may be a problem for some applications. Bought them to use with my ST series Panasonic and they sync/work just fine. I'm not real big on 3D so I just wanted a couple pairs to toy with, without the big investment. Battery is a standard 2025 which for some odd reason is not noted anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Todd_623

customer_reviews.title: RF 3D on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: Works with my Epson V11H501020 PowerLite Home Cinema 3020 projector and works well. They seemed a bit flimsy on first inspection and have no side view blocking which tends to distract you from the 3D experience. Overall though, they work well and for the price, they can't be beat as an extra pair for visiting guest or children who might be less inclined to treat stuff delicately.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these items. Wasn't sure what to expect. However, they arrived quickly and I tested using Call of Duty game. They were clear and worked extremely well for the price. If you want an inexpensive set of 3D glasses these work well. Pros: Inexpensive, work with Samsung 3D Tv, easy to connect Cons: Cheap plastic casing, doesn't sit extremely well on face. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D glasses
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these 3D glasses to have extra pairs for when family and friends come over to watch a 3D movie on my Samsung tv. They arrived quickly and in original manufacturing packaging. They look and work just great like the original pair that I got when I purchased my tv. I wear glasses so they fit nicely and comfortably over them. I would definitely recommend to anyone . They don't feel awkward when watching a movie either.
customer_reviews.author: Liz B

customer_reviews.title: Price Excellent. Quality Average.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these as glasses for my children as I could not see $60 as a good buy for youngsters. The work fine with my panasonic plasma but if you are buying these as your primary glasses for yourself you will probably be disappointed. The are not as comfortable to wear and are less durable than the panasonic brand 3d glasses. Again great for kids or if you need several pairs for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With Panasonic Plasma (2012 model)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as opposed to the pricier Panasonic brand ones and right out of the box they work great with my. I really like how they fit over glasses too. The arms extend from close to the center of the glasses instead of the extremities, so the arms rest on top of my glasses' rims and everything sits nicely.
customer_reviews.author: P.Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cool!
customer_reviews.text: My TV came with two pairs, and I bought four more. They're comfortable on my huge noggin and work okay with my glasses...better than the non-active throwaways you get at the theatre. The only thing I don't like about them is that while there is an on button, I can't be certain I have turned them off or if they go off automatically. Consequently, I pull the batteries after I use them, which isn't often because of the few 3D movies I have.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Roden

customer_reviews.title: buy for spares or company
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even put the batteries in these yet but was pleased to see they ARE the correct glasses for my newly purchased 3D TV. Buyers need to make sure that they are ordering 3D glasses compatible with the tv model they have in house or they may not work. I purchased these explicitly to use in the event of asking company over for a movie as I had only two pair with the original tv purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CO Native_Jody

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Glasses!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two additional pairs, because I had ordered a 3D tv, blu ray combo that brought two pairs and I wanted two more atleast for now. The glasses work great, It has an off/on switch and it comes with the batteries and their fit inside each other for storage. They don't take too much room. If I need more, I will definitely order again from here. Everything was shipped super fast:)
customer_reviews.author: applecinnamon06

customer_reviews.title: Samsung SSG-41000GB 3D glasses
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung 3D glasses work and are easy to use but are uncomfortable to wear. Also, since the push button to turn on and off is the LED mode display light, you in effect cover the LED when turning off or on and therefore it is difficult to tell what mode the glasses are in. If I watched much 3D TV, I would buy the Panasonic glasses, but I went cheap and got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works with Panasonic 3D TV
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use with my Panasonic VIERA TC-L55DT50 and they work fine. I can't compare them with the much more expensive $60 panasonic 3D glasses but they work well enough that I will probably never purchase the panasonic ones. Very thin and light- if you didn't see the tiny power button and LED you would probably think they were the passive 3d glasses they give out at the movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: BYC

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper than the 'official' Panasonic ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new 2012 Panasonic Viera Plasma TV. It came with no 3D glasses. We have very little 3D content available, so I wasn't inclined to spend the $70+ for a couple pair of the Panasonic glasses that you're supposed to use with the TV. These are massively cheaper, and they work perfectly! If you're looking at the Panasonic ones for a 2011-2012 TV, buy these instead!
customer_reviews.author: A. Rathbun

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine with 2012 Panasonic Viera Plasma and LED/LCD
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat frail but very economical. Not rechargeable. Light can enter easily from sides making daytime usage less desirable. Not sure what battery life will be. We have 2 of Panasonic's expensive 3D glasses that we let guests use while we use the Samsungs. For some reason the Samsungs seem to work readily without the registration process required by the Panasonic glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely in the right conditions
customer_reviews.text: These worked well on my Panasonic TC-P55UT50. I am really surprised at how nice 3D looks on the TV with these glasses. Better that the experience I get at a theatre IMO. I would suggest that you remove all lighting from the sides and front as well as distractions. I know the actual panasonic ones help reduce outside lighting and distractions but cost 2 or 3 times as much. these are just fine in a controlled environment. If there was more 3d content I would probably pick up some more pairs of these.
customer_reviews.author: mdog73

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Panasonic TC-P50UT50 plasma
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should and synching is as easy as pushing a button. My only gripe comes from the clip on frames. They don't fold like eyeglasses, so you either have to store the units fully assembled (bulky and delicate - not a good combo) or assemble/disassemble them every time you want to use them.
customer_reviews.author: E.Toblerone

customer_reviews.title: These do the job but don't block out much for ...
customer_reviews.text: These do the job but don't block out much for the side which can be irritating and in the middle of the glasses where the battery is placed the cover becomes loose and does not close anymore which makes the glasses become useless
customer_reviews.author: drummer

customer_reviews.title: 3D glassess
customer_reviews.text: Ordering from Amazon was easy as usual. The glasses are not heavy. Theses are the most comfortable of all the ones I tried at the various stores. I did not get a headache with the active model. I am able to wear these glasses for the entire movie or football game. The images on the TV are sharp and clear. I am glad I took the chance and ordered them without trying them on. Although returning anything to Amazon has never been a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: cajunnurse

customer_reviews.title: A less expensive option to Panasonic glasses
customer_reviews.text: These work just as good as the more expensive Panasonic glasses. You will need to have extra batteries available, but they are inexpensive. The only downside to these glasses is that they do not have any side covering and allow light from the side which can be annoying when watching dim 3D pictures. If you are in a dark room, this woud not be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Levron

customer_reviews.title: A fine replacement for the official, expensive Panasonic version
customer_reviews.text: These work just as well as the Panasonic models which cost 3-4x as much. As other reviewers mention, they are less good at blocking peripheral light, but this also means they are easier to fit over eyeglasses. They use disposable 2025 cell batteries, so stock up. (The spendier Panasonics are rechargeable.)
customer_reviews.author: Clayton W. Hibbert

customer_reviews.title: Glasses are super light and work great
customer_reviews.text: PROS: SUPER light weight. The wrap around style makes them great if you wear glasses as well. The 3D effect is pretty amazing. Auto power off is amazing. Sync to TV COULD NOT be easier (I have a 2011 Samsung tv) CONS: The power button is a little awkward to turn on. Lastly, this is not a knock against the glasses, but I have found that I do get headaches with the active glasses on, vs passive which don't seem to cause the headaches. I need to investigate more, but this could be something to consider. Overall: Highly recommend these if you're in the market.
customer_reviews.author: djtiger

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 3D glasses work on the 2012 Panasonic TVs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Samsung SCG-4100GB 3D glasses after my research turned up that they were compatible with my Panasonic VT 50 Plasma TV. They work great. I gave them a 4 of 5 stars only because once you assemble them then you can not store them in a case. They are most useful if you dont need to fit them over eyglasses. While they do fit over most eyeglasses when you do so they are further from your face and let more light in from the side and can impact your viewing.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: These work well for Panasonic 3D
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my Panasonic 3D Plasma TV. These were great, the 3D was incredible. These need to be put together and they do not fold closed, so storage is difficult. This is my only real con for this product. They are easy to change the battery and they are light weight. Over glasses is a little difficult, you need to get them on just right. These are a great price for the 3 D glasses and compared to the $70 pair from Panasonic, these are way better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: New 3D viewer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 3d active glasses
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly @ 19.95 I got four pair for the price of 1 pair of Panasonic glasses. Not as good a quality as the Panasonic but for casual use they fit the bill My P60ST60 came with 2 pair of Oem glasses that my wife & I will use on a more regular basis. These will be for guests and I have tried them out and the results are excellent. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Great original samsung glasses for an unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: They work just as well as the original glasses that I bought with my Samsung 3D tv one year ago, which I would expect as these are the same Samsung glasses. The price however has come down considerably, it has basically bean sliced in half!. Now I can play games, watch 3D movies with 3 friends.
customer_reviews.author: AA Westenberg

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and brilliant color!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are so light weight compared to another brand I have for my other 3D TV. They also let a brilliant color come thru. I love using them and watching TV, bought more for friends to enjoy when they come over. They are great. Cost is very good also compared to others. I hope they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ralphh909

customer_reviews.title: Very good value with good results
customer_reviews.text: When I bought our new Samsung 3D HDTV, two sets of these glasses came with the set and they worked very well. I checked out other ACTIVE 3D glasses because I wanted more a comfortable set that would fit over my eye glasses which is why these didn't get my 5 star rating. Otherwise, these are great 3D glasses. ACTIVE is the key word.
customer_reviews.author: CBW51

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable option for 3D tv
customer_reviews.text: I can't bring myself to pay ridiculous amounts of money for 3D glasses so I decided to try these. I use the with my Panasonic VIERA TC-P55ST50 and I love them. I order some extra batteries with them which were really inexpensive. I prefer the battery option as opposed to the rechargeable option on the more expensive glasses. The glasses are plastic and they don't fold so you must be careful not to sit on them or anything.
customer_reviews.author: SodaCity

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We have had no issues and these are great for young children (that tend to not treat these type of things gingerly). Also great for guests! Not the best fit, and does not filter peripheral light so using them in a well lite room is not recommended. However, you cannot beat the $17 dollar price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Pharr

customer_reviews.title: works with panasonic 50 series tv's
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 pairs for use with my panasonic 60st50 tv. I got a couple of the panny glasses for my wife and me. The samsung glasses are for the kids. They work fine. Not as good as the panasonic glasses but they cost much less. They come with a cloth for cleaning which we use frequently since my kids get their finger prints on them regularly.
customer_reviews.author: KidHorn

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Takes the beating my 5 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Takes the beating my 5 year old gives it as well as sitting firmly on my face when I don't need my 5 year old to beat them up! Batteries last a long while and are easy to change. No screw drivers required!
customer_reviews.author: CaimanHunter

customer_reviews.title: Great for Guests, Over Glasses, and 2012+ Panasonic TV's!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2012 Panasonic 3D TV but these were so much less so gave them a shot. They worked out great and I actually think I like these more since they easily fit over my glasses. The Panasonic's look a little more 3D to me but they also are darker when turned on. I'm happy with the Samsung's and at 1/25th the price of the Panny's. 2Cool
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These work great on my Samsung plasma tv from 2011-2012. Better than the newer ones I have that I got at Best Buy. These ones you can not see the shutters opening and closing at all (which give the 3d effect) where as my newer versions of these you can see it like your blinking extremely fast. These are a must buy for any samsung 3d tv that fit the 2011-2012 years.
customer_reviews.author: Fres9056

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Paired with epson 5020 in no time. Not a great build quality but are comfortable to wear and picture looks good. Have to remove the sides to store it properly. Compare to the epson glasses which come with the projector these looks cheap but will buy some more as backup if friends join us for movie night.
customer_reviews.author: KCGuy

customer_reviews.title: If u want the standard "Cheap" versions
customer_reviews.text: These are the standard ,or "Cheap" version. They work better for people with glasses,and of course the best choice for children because of both structural & flexible durability,and lets not forget Price!!!!!!!!! For the more discriminating person,there is a very,Very Nice Upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Toushin

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I use 6 of these at the same time with Samsung UN55ES7100. They are light, easy to use and work well. These are awesome glasses. The batteries are watch sized. You can order a 5 pack from Amazon on the cheap, Energizer 2032 BATTERY LITHIUM 3V (PACK OF 5). If you have a compatible TV, I recommend these glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: An In Expensive trip in to 3D
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with my Panasonic Plasma 55 inch TV. They are a fraction of the cost of the panasonic glasses and perform as well (I have some of both brands). A true bargain. They include the batteries which seem to last a long time. I wasn't convinced 3D was worth the investment but there is some content on cable so I thought I'd give it a go. Bought these glasses for a modest investment and was surprised at the quality of the 3D at home experience. Well worth the price of these glasses and if you don't use them much you can experience 3D at home for just a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul T. Lococo

customer_reviews.title: Goofy Looking,  But they work great.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses do exactly what they are suppose to do. Very light weight. After a few minutes, you don't know that you are wearing them. They fit over your prescription glasses uneventfully. The only thing I would change on these glasses is the on/off button. If the button was raised even just a little, it would be easier to click on and off. Other than that, this item is a go!
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Panasonic plasma TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with my Panasonic TV. They work just fine with it and fit over my regular glasses.. Fast shipment. They're not rechargeable but since I don't watch much 3D the claimed 150 hour life is plenty and replacement batteries are cheap. I took one star off because they're not real comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.text: What can I say, I opened the box took out the glasses installed the battery when to the TV activa5ted them gave them to my grand kids and they had a ball watching The Lion King. ) The original glasses that came with the TV never worked and Samsung did NOT honor there so called warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Glasses work great
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a 3D TV and 2 pairs of 3d glasses. Needed to get additional pairs of glasses so the whole family could enjoy the 3d movies. Decided to look online to see if i could get a better deal on the 3d glasses. Found a better deal here on Amazon and the glasses were shipped out right away. The glasses are a bit smaller than the original glasses I purchased with the TV. Other than the size difference they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H

customer_reviews.title: 3D is good but still some ghosting effect
customer_reviews.text: Active 3D seems to present a more stable picture than passive, but there is still some ghosting. I use these glasses with a 60" plasma TV, and the picture is amazing. These are the only glasses I can use with that TV right now, and they get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Panasonic ST50 (2012) plasma
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat these active shutter glasses. Instantly recognized by my Panasonic plasma. Glad that Panasonic and Samsung went to a RF standard on their TVs (2012 & newer). Watch battery (CR-2025) powered means no charging and cheap battery replacement. Would highly recommend at this price, performance is great.
customer_reviews.author: The Chuckster

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness I did buy the expensive ones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to work with my Panasonic Smart Viera - the ones Panasonic makes were a lot more expensive. These work very well. As a matter of fact I bought 4 extra pairs for friends when they come over to watch a 3-D movie. So I bought 6 pairs for the about the same price as one of the Panasonic. No brainier
customer_reviews.author: S. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use in front of eyeglasses
customer_reviews.text: The temple pieces are too light and flexible, so the glasses tend to skew in front of eyeglasses. I'd have been happier with a more traditional frame with straight temple pieces and larger lenses. Otherwise they synch easily and work fine with our Samsung 3D TV.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cocuzzo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working just fine with my Samsung Smart TV. I also received these in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Don't spend the extra money on the expensive glasses unless your area isn't completely dark. If there is any light in your Peripheral vision. That is the only case to spend more money otherwise these are GREAT! Picture quality is amazing and the glasses are light enough where they are comfortable for any head size.
customer_reviews.author: gmeend

customer_reviews.title: Small size
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my kids. I would guess they're a little small for most adults. They're definitely uncomfortable when wearing them over my regular glasses. The lenses don't wrap around and the peripheral light is distracting. Assembly and pairing was simple. The power/sync button is tiny and sometimes hard to locate in a dark room. I'm happy with the price and think these will work fine as spare set.
customer_reviews.author: I heart tacos

customer_reviews.title: Replacement 3D Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I have several Panasonic Vierra 3D glasses designed to eliminate more light from the sides and cost 2 plus times more than the Samsung SSG-4100GD. I found with the room dark the Samsung 3D glasses work just as well and were lighter: which made a difference for those already wearing reading glasses. There was no compatibility issues. I gave a four star rating because of the better side blocking ability of the Panasonic version.
customer_reviews.author: Goodhelp

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use with a JVC RS4810 projector and I can confirm they work great with the JVC RF dongle. For the price, these 3D active glasses are a great deal. The glasses are light weight and comfortable to wear. I will probably be buying a few more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the Epson Powerlite Home Cinema 3020
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these. They work perfectly with the Epson Powerlite Home Cinema 3020. The 3D is amazing. You may want to block any light from the side or back of the room, otherwise you may get some glare. You can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: O from Reno

customer_reviews.title: Good standard Samsung Glasses, shame about the packing
customer_reviews.text: These are standard glasses that connected to my Samsung TV with no issues and they are excellent, However, they were packaged in a small box with just old newspapers around them, As a result one glass cracked, got blotted (with LCD?) and are totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: WH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These glasses look cool, are comfortable and very light, they work fantastically, and you still have peripheral and lower vision, so you can still look at a computer screen/digital remote/etc and read it. Normally, you cant looks very long at a non-3D screen because of the shuttering. Didn't give 5 stars only because I have not tried other active glasses. However for 2-4x as much $, I dont think I ever will. :)
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Works with  my Panasonic tv
customer_reviews.text: Got a new Panasonic 3D TV for the bedroom and found out that the glasses from my 2-3 year old 3D TV in the family room wouldn't work with the new TV. Did research and found that these glasses would work and they do. Not too expensive and they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Good glasses
customer_reviews.text: Samsung was one of the only manufacturers that gave glasses with its 3d tvs. It also has cheaper pairs then all the others. They are not too bad for the price. Only complaints I have of them is that they sometimes show a glare if you have light coming in on them from the sides and they can twist on your head a little bit but that isn't such a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: 3D for the whole family without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.text: I have a Viera ST50 and freaked out when I saw how much the Panasonic 3D glasses were. These work great for a fraction of the price. I'm trying to figure out a way to do without the temples and clip the frames on to my glasses. If I can get that to work then these are 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pehrson

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: They work. I am using them with a Panasonic ST50 55 inch syncing is no issue and works every time. My wife can wear these over her glasses no problem. These are only good in near black out conditions because their design lets in a lot of ambient light so be aware if you have bright rooms. The glasses shipped quickly and were packaged nucely as is normal for Amazon. I would recommend to someone who is curious but not serious about 3D.
customer_reviews.author: s60maven

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: There's a few options out there, but these relatively inexpensive glasses work great with our new (2012-3) Samsung plasma TV. They're comfortable and the 3D effect is great. Now only if we could find some half decent 3D content to watch....
customer_reviews.author: Ian R. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these for a Panasonic TV and they work fine. Good cheap glasses for the kids (I bought my wife and I a more expensive Panasonic pair - still not sure if the extra expense was worth it.) Haven't used them enough to really rate them with confidence, but for the money, it's hard to complain.
customer_reviews.author: GCB

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfy with the product. The great thing is that whenever I see 3D TV of aany other brand, the glasses seem to lower the light in the picture. This glasses seem to enhance the light in the screen and I can see colors almost as vivid as 2D Blue Ray (without glasses)
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: These are very good!!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little apprehensive buying these for my Panasonic 60 inch 3d, but guess what. Worked first attempt. Very good glasses at a very reasonable price. Don't know why the Panasonic ones are as expensive as they are.
customer_reviews.author: Shravan Sundaram

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and effective
customer_reviews.text: These were substantially less expensive than anything else out there. The battery door is a little tough to open. They easily fit over my prescription glasses. The lenses could be bigger. Fits kids just fine. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Winokur

customer_reviews.title: 3D Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Just being the two of us we needed additional glasses for our children and grandchildren when they visit. I like these special "made for our tv" glasses because all you need to do is push a button and they're activated.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Samsung SSG-4100GB 3D Active Glasses 2012 Models - Black
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely agree with "W. I. Group" review. These glasses are not best but for the price are good. Bought 2 of these for my Samsung HDTV. TV comes with Samsung SSG-3050G glasses which are darker than SSG-4100GB but are more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lasha

customer_reviews.title: family movie time
customer_reviews.text: For $18 each, I got 5 so that the whole family could watch the movies at one time. Buy the new version SSG-5100GB that works with the 2013 Samsung TVs also and several other brands of 3D TVs.
customer_reviews.author: William Moll

customer_reviews.title: Works with 2012 Panasonic TV
customer_reviews.text: Paired easily and quickly with my Panasonic TV 2012. The glass do let in a little to much light, but to to be honest, you really have to watch 3D in the dark anyway. Way cheaper then buying the Panasonic glasses and just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the unbelievable price! ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the unbelievable price! ... It was just what I was looking for and works prefect and correctly! ... I could not have picked a better ... 5 Stars for esrte product! ..
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Sieveres

customer_reviews.title: A lot for the money and only ones that work with Epson RF 3d system, 3020, 5020
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong for the money. These work with just about all RF 3d projectors, Epson 3020 and 5020. These are not the highest quality frames and the side viewing could be better, but for the price in keep 20 pairs for large groups of guests. The core viewers have glasses that are 5 times as much a pair. Save some money. These do the trick and are light, so you do not feel them on...
customer_reviews.author: John D Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product for my Samsung Plasma
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a 60" Samsung Plasma 3D TV from Amazon and needed extra 3D glasses for the TV. Purchased these and were very happy with them. Green/red light at the top of the glasses let me know if the product is on or off and its a pretty comfortable fit. No problems with image view.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Work great. Get one for each friend coming over for movie night
customer_reviews.text: These RF active 3D glasses are the cheapest, yet beautifully functional glasses in their class. Works with my new Epson 6020, and any other 3D TV using RF for active 3D. Auto turn off if no 3D signal...batteries last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Insite4U

customer_reviews.title: Great Transaction
customer_reviews.text: These are priced excellent. The product shipped very promptly and they worked excellent. I bought four pair plus two pair came with the TV. Now my family of four can enjoy and if a couple guests come over they can enjoy with us.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter71

customer_reviews.title: 3-d glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought an extra pair of 3-d glasses for my (Samsung 51 inch E-550) 3-d tv. The tv came with two pairs but I wanted an extra pair for a spare. They work perfectly. The price was good, they perform great - what more could I want?
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card Recipient

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have a Panasonic ST50. Worked and paired perfectly. I had to give glasses four stars since the frame allows in a significant amount of light that hinders your ability to be immersed in the 3D experience. Overall, as the rating suggest, I was pleased with the product performance and the price made it easy to look over the its' shortcomings (the light).
customer_reviews.author: Marco Mireles

customer_reviews.title: For how much they are, they work great
customer_reviews.text: Most people say they feel cheap, while they do not feel super heavy duty. I love how light they are. They do let a lot of light in from your peripheral so I suggest only watching 3D content in a dark environment.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable 3D glasses.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work great and are very affordable. I'm not a big fan of the way the battery is replaced, but if you are careful it's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Superman Fan

customer_reviews.title: Finally cheaper glasses for 3D TVs
customer_reviews.text: These work great with the Samsung plasma I bought in Sep 2011. Definitely better than the bulky ones that came with the TV and about a third of the price. Only thing is they don't block out light from the side.
customer_reviews.author: S Miller

customer_reviews.title: These glasses rock
customer_reviews.text: Coupled with our new Samsung 3D tv we have really come to enjoy the 3d viewing. Glasses are especially light fitting and comfortable. These were purchased to augment the ones included with the TV set.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: great 3d experience
customer_reviews.text: I ordered four more pairs of these glasses as the TV only came with two. I initially thought that the 3d effect was going to be a disappointment, but much to my surprise it is even more effective than in the movie theater!
customer_reviews.author: Marcoo

product_meta.title: Samsung SSG-4100GB 3D Active Glasses 2012 Models - Black
product_meta.description: Samsung SSG-4100GB 3D Active Glasses (2012 Models) - Black.Compatibility: The Samsung 3D Active Glasses (SSG-4100GB) are compatible with 2011-up Samsung LED-LCD & Plasma 3D-ready TVs (D, E, and ES series). You must also have a 3D-ready Blu-ray player with 3D content, or a satellite/cable provider broadcasting in 3D. Note: Not compatible with previous Samsung TV's which featured a 3D Sync IR output, or 2010 Samsung 3D-ready TVs with IR emitter.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars399 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
